comment: Ms. Viki's lectures were really vague and hard to understand at times. Most of the time the assignments made sense when Ms. Viki would explain them, but then she would give us a sort of cookie cutter guideline that usually didn't work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Made up of 3 "big" assignments and weekly discussions. Discussions based on a mostly interesting book. Just make sure to write a response and reply to 2 peers every week. Provides great feedback on essays. She allows you to resubmit assignments for a better grade. She responds quickly to emails and tries to help you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Super sweet and nice. She will extend due dates if you ask . Took her online and was very easy. 3 paper assignments and weekly discussions from a book that was actually an enjoyable read. I'd take her if you can.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: There was a 250 word discussion post due every week, then a step of your paper due on a different day of the week. She is really good about giving a lot of feedback & is understanding with due dates. She can seem condescending, although I'm not sure that she means for it to seem that way. She also doesn't put grades into D2L all semester :(

The teach communicates very well with each student and wants everyone to pass. She will help you with whatever you need and allow you to have some creative freedom to your writing. There are only three papers and a discussion board that enhances your writing skills. All and all the class is not too hard if you keep up with what is going on and proofread your papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: I wouldn't consider myself an amazing writer but she loved all my papers and graded them with ease. She gives you opportunities to make up things and honestly cares for her students. She is a bit unorganized so she can be a little confusing from time to time. If you take this class try to be in contact with her and other classmates for clarity
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests? Not many--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I did not like her very much. She was a good professor just not my favorite. There are a lot of rhetorical analysis throughout the year and major assignments so you will most likely be writing a paper every week. She is very unorganized. If you are taking her with a learning a community it pays off because Danelle is amazing.

Overall good teacher, this is college so there will be work and you won't be spoon fed. Keep mind of the schedule she gives in the syllabus, although it could vary a little. 3 essays (mainly just the rough drafts), last one is a multi-model group project tied in to an essay.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Good professor. Assignments aren't hard & there aren't a lot. Gives great feedback on essays & has clear grading style. Gives a ton of extra credit if you don't miss class. A piece of cake class if you somewhat know how to write a paper. There is a ton of opportunities to succeed. Definitely recommend.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If you're a writer, this class is a piece of cake. Plenty of opportunity to do well. She allows you to redo essays. 4 essays, 1 presentation that was interview based on our previous essays. Quizzes online, and if you miss less than one day she adds 10 points to your final average.  No need to worry about her grading, she's pretty clear.

Vicki has such a kind heart. The class was harder than I expected, but she gives lots of great feedback and is very willing to work with students. She cares about the class and wants them to succeed. You do one big project and work on it all semester. She gives you just enough structure for this, but mostly allows you to do your own thing.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very nice, if you participate in class she will love you. Most of my papers I wrote the night before and still got an A or B. If you email her she will always respond and help you. She can get a little grumpy and sassy but if you are just continually nice to her she will apologize and give you the info you need.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very nice lady, but her instructions are very confusing. We have one topic that we keep through out the semester and do multiple papers on that. It was very hard to find a topic as she would say no to most suggestions. Their is one final project of interviewing people and doing original research. Her class gave me anxiety.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Vicki is probably one of the sweetest and also most helpful professors. You can definitely get by without the text. Follow her instructions on each assignment, and a grade of at least a B is guaranteed
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This is a fairly demanding course, considering the fact that it is a gen-ed requirement, but Dr. Vicki is willing to work with students and is pretty lenient. You work on one research project all semester, and do a series of papers about it, which can be tough, but her feedback is really detailed. You can honestly probably get by without the text.

Vikki is one of the best. She is very clear what she wants in a paper. If you follow the guidelines, 9/10 times you will get at least a B. One project for both the 1101 and 1102 classes. Bottom line I took her for both semesters my freshmen year and I wish I could take her again. Doesn't lecture much, lots of group interaction.
She is a good professor. She is willing to help when you need it. I would definitely take her again.

Great professor, one of the best i've had a kennesaw. she is a really great professor, she helps with every assignment and is willing to take things late if you have problems with the assignment and gives rewrites

Loved this class! Easy A as long as you pay attention and check the assignment sheets. She's understanding and pushed a due date back for us one time. Took this as a hybrid so couldn't miss more than two classes. First project is a group project but its not hard. Fun class. Easy intro into college writing.

Don't waste your time with this class. Professor Armour-Hileman judges you based on your personality.  I took her as a hybrid due to crazy work schedule, though there was not much work, I never quite understood what she wanted. Personally, I thought she was somewhat rude. Her instructions are not clear. I do not recommend taking this class.

She can be super friendly and will usually offer extensions for projects and papers as long as you ask for one. She can talk down to you at times but I think she doesn't try to. She definitely grades papers very harshly, especially if you don't follow directions. Expect a paper or assignment every other week (but it's not as bad as it sounds.)

Whenever she gave an assignment, her instructions were unclear and she constantly changed the instructions and due date so it was extremely difficult to know what to do for the assignments. She graded harshly but didn't tell us what she wanted from us. She also had a very condescending approach to answering questions we asked.

I'm an ok student, I just do what it takes to pass. I'm NO kiss ass. so when i tell you she is AMAZING i mean it! We had 3 tests,  1 presentation, quizzes and a final(presentation). the tests are ALL open book, and you can use your phonelaptop for the quizzes & tests if you "dont want a hard copy"(catch my drift). she made me enjoy literature, fr

Professor Armour- Hileman is awesome! I was in a learning community with all girls and she made sure we understood everything! If the class doesn't understand one her her assignments she will change it to best suite the class! She's big on specifics in your essays and if you're not satisfied with your grade you can rewrite it! Take her!

She said this was her first time teaching, so she was lenient on a lot of things. There were three tests that were on the readings. You take them in class, and you can use your notes. Sounds difficult but it wasn't that bad. Two projects throughout and overall she was pretty cool. I would take her again!!

After reading past reviews, the ones that say she will judge you by your personality is true. She is not sure on what she wants in her papers, and says one thing, but when she grades it, its totally different. Takes forever to grade little things, such as a peer review from August that she hasn't graded and its almost the end of the semester. no go
Just don't. She is not the hardest teacher but there are a lot better teachers that you can choose from.
She is decent. no tests, 2 video projects, and a couple of essays. nothing crazy. she is sometimes hard to understand how she wants your papers to be, and willing to move back due dates to help you.
Take this class to offset your heavy load in other classes. I didn't find it particularly challenging academically but I appreciated how she challenged me personally. The assignments were fun to do.

This class is good if you are into visuals or theater, then I definitely recommend her, she requires a PSA, and audio visual for a paper. She is difficult grader- get on her good side. She will try to help you as best she can and she knows a lot about her subject. The class isn't hard just very time consuming.

Good sense of humor most of the time. She does grade papers pretty strict, but they can all be redone if needed. Attendance is mandatory although if enough people skip she won't go through with the grade drop. Same goes for the reading.

Hileman is awesome! Funny, sweet, understanding. If you need extra time on an assignment you just have to ask ahead of time. Never gives F's on papers unless you just don't turn them in. Lets you rewrite any paper you'd like for a better grade. Read the directions for every assignment and try to give her what shes asking for and you'll do fine.

sweet lady, grades easy. I made a C in the class and that was without even doing one of the papers. Made As on all the others. She doesn't like fluff so don't use big words in your writing and you should be fine. Include personal stories instead.

Extremely picky. She has her own idea of how things should be written and if they're not written in that way you get a bad grade. She's willing to help but not very clear on what she wants. The average grade on her papers is a C. You have to work very hard and it may not even pay off.  Take another professor if possible

In my opinion be aware, if she doesn't like your personality then you are going to get a bad grade, regardless of the quality of your work. Had other people  professors and graduates look at my work after I received a grade and they all agreed I had been marked extremely low!! Take another professor if possible!
Good teacher, wants to help you. Isn't super clear on what she wants but lets you rewrite all your papers. Over all good teacher, very understanding.
